Add dose level (DL) column

Source: R/nif_class.R
add_dose_level.Rd

Dose level is defined as the starting dose. For data sets with single drug administration, DLis a numerical value, for drug combinations, it is a character value specifying the PARENT and dose level for the individual components.

Usage

add_dose_level(obj)

Arguments

obj

A NIF dataset.

Value

A NIF dataset.

Examples

head(add_dose_level(examplinib_sad_nif))
#>   REF ID    STUDYID           USUBJID AGE SEX  RACE HEIGHT WEIGHT      BMI
#> 1   1  1 2023000001 20230000011010003  26   0 WHITE  185.6   84.2 24.44309
#> 2   2  1 2023000001 20230000011010003  26   0 WHITE  185.6   84.2 24.44309
#> 3   3  1 2023000001 20230000011010003  26   0 WHITE  185.6   84.2 24.44309
#> 4   4  1 2023000001 20230000011010003  26   0 WHITE  185.6   84.2 24.44309
#> 5   5  1 2023000001 20230000011010003  26   0 WHITE  185.6   84.2 24.44309
#> 6   6  1 2023000001 20230000011010003  26   0 WHITE  185.6   84.2 24.44309
#>                   DTC TIME NTIME TAFD TAD PCELTM EVID AMT ANALYTE CMT PARENT
#> 1 2000-12-28 10:14:00  0.0   0.0  0.0 0.0   <NA>    1   5  RS2023   1 RS2023
#> 2 2000-12-28 10:14:00  0.0   0.0  0.0 0.0   PT0H    0   0  RS2023   2 RS2023
#> 3 2000-12-28 10:44:00  0.5   0.5  0.5 0.5 PT0.5H    0   0  RS2023   2 RS2023
#> 4 2000-12-28 11:14:00  1.0   1.0  1.0 1.0   PT1H    0   0  RS2023   2 RS2023
#> 5 2000-12-28 11:44:00  1.5   1.5  1.5 1.5 PT1.5H    0   0  RS2023   2 RS2023
#> 6 2000-12-28 12:14:00  2.0   2.0  2.0 2.0   PT2H    0   0  RS2023   2 RS2023
